intro: Eupatorium bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple, arranged in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane forests and wetlands. Eupatorium bogotense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
